predictions.text: U.S. Producer Price Index (Final Demand, MoM, SA) for November 2025 will print between -0.1% and +0.3%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via BLS news release 'Producer Price Index — November 2025'. Use seasonally adjusted final demand MoM change; range inclusive.
evidence: Recent disinflation trend with muted goods price pressures
Energy prices have been range-bound; limited pass-through
Soft manufacturing pricing signals
monitoring_signals: WTI and refined products prices into the print
Corporate earnings commentary on input costs
predictions.rationale: Goods disinflation and stable energy suggest modest PPI.

predictions.text: U.S. PPI Final Demand less Food, Energy, and Trade Services (MoM, SA) for November 2025 will print between +0.0% and +0.3%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via BLS PPI release table for 'Final demand less foods, energy, and trade services' MoM; seasonally adjusted; range inclusive.
evidence: Core pipeline pressures easing but not collapsing
Service margins relatively stable
Limited wage-cost acceleration in recent data
predictions.rationale: Core pipeline inflation remains subdued yet positive.

predictions.text: U.S. Retail Sales (Advance, total, MoM, SA) for November 2025 will print between -0.3% and +0.4%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via Census Bureau 'Advance Monthly Retail Trade and Food Services' Table 1, seasonally adjusted MoM percent change; range inclusive.
evidence: Mixed holiday season indicators; softer big-ticket demand
Lower gasoline prices dampen nominal sales
E-commerce strength offsets weakness in discretionary goods
monitoring_signals: Gasoline retail prices into the reference period
Manheim used vehicle index for autos component
predictions.rationale: Holiday promotions and cheaper gas yield modest headline.

predictions.text: U.S. Retail Sales Control Group (ex autos, gas, building materials, food services; MoM, SA) for November 2025 will print between -0.1% and +0.5%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Census 'control group' concept (retail & food services excluding motor vehicles & parts, gasoline stations, building materials & garden equipment, and food services & drinking places). Verify via Census release or FRED RSXFS; MoM SA; range inclusive.
evidence: Core goods volumes steady; promotional discounting
E-commerce resilience
Flat to modestly positive real spending trend
monitoring_signals: Card-spend trackers for core retail categories
Inventory/sales ratios in retail earnings updates
predictions.rationale: Solid core retail offset by discounting keeps gains modest.

predictions.text: U.S. Industrial Production (MoM, SA) for November 2025 will print between -0.3% and +0.3%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via Federal Reserve G.17 release; total industrial production, seasonally adjusted percent change MoM; range inclusive.
evidence: Manufacturing activity remains soft; sub-50 ISM
Energy output steady; utilities weather-dependent
Autos production normalizing
predictions.rationale: Muted factory activity and stable energy cap overall moves.

predictions.text: U.S. Capacity Utilization (Total Industry, SA) for November 2025 will print between 78.0% and 79.6%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via Federal Reserve G.17; total industry capacity utilization, seasonally adjusted percent level; range inclusive.
evidence: Utilization has trended slightly below long-run average
Soft manufacturing tempers utilization gains
No major energy outages
monitoring_signals: Fed regional surveys on capacity and orders backlogs
predictions.rationale: Slack persists with modest variation around recent levels.

predictions.text: U.S. Housing Starts (SAAR) for November 2025 will print between 1.30 million and 1.45 million.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via Census/HUD New Residential Construction; headline Housing Starts, seasonally adjusted annual rate; range inclusive.
evidence: Mortgage rates eased from peaks, aiding builders
Elevated new-home share supports starts
Tight existing-home supply backdrop
predictions.rationale: Lower rates and tight supply stabilize starts within range.

predictions.text: U.S. Building Permits (SAAR) for November 2025 will print between 1.38 million and 1.55 million.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via Census/HUD New Residential Construction; Building Permits, seasonally adjusted annual rate; range inclusive.
evidence: Improving buyer traffic boosts permitting
Builders responding to easing rate environment
Backlogs support pipeline
monitoring_signals: NAHB buyer traffic and sales expectations
Mortgage rate moves and lock volumes
predictions.rationale: Permits track builder optimism, improving on rate relief.

predictions.text: Philadelphia Fed Manufacturing Business Outlook Survey General Activity Index for December 2025 will print between -8.0 and +8.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via Philadelphia Fed MBO survey release; headline General Activity Index; range inclusive.
evidence: Regional manufacturing remains weak but volatile
Orders/backlogs soft, slight improvement possible
Price pressures easing
predictions.rationale: Sideways manufacturing with high month-to-month noise.

predictions.text: NY Fed Empire State Manufacturing Survey General Business Conditions Index for December 2025 will print between -15.0 and 0.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via New York Fed release; headline General Business Conditions Index; range inclusive.
evidence: Northeast manufacturing lagging broader U.S.
Weak new orders and shipments reported recently
Inventory adjustment cycle persists
monitoring_signals: Supplier delivery times and backlog indicators
predictions.rationale: Empire State tends to print weak amid soft orders.

predictions.text: University of Michigan 1-year inflation expectations (final) for December 2025 will print between 2.8% and 3.4%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via University of Michigan 'Surveys of Consumers' final December release; 1-year inflation expectations; range inclusive.
evidence: Gasoline prices have eased into December
Inflation news flow less alarming recently
Preliminary December readings were contained
predictions.rationale: Gasoline relief anchors near-term expectations within range.

predictions.text: University of Michigan 5-year inflation expectations (final) for December 2025 will print between 2.8% and 3.2%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via University of Michigan final December release; 5-year inflation expectations; range inclusive.
evidence: Long-run expectations have remained range-bound
Limited shock news on inflation
Stable rate expectations near term
predictions.rationale: Anchored long-run views persist amid steady policy guidance.

predictions.text: OFAC will announce at least one China-related sanctions designation via a U.S. Treasury press release by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A Treasury/OFAC press release listing China/PRC-linked persons or entities (domiciled in China or sanctioned for China-related activity) added to the SDN List by the deadline.
evidence: Rising U.S. scrutiny of Chinese tech and security risks
Frequent year-end OFAC activity across programs
Bipartisan hardening on China policy
predictions.rationale: Policy momentum and typical year-end cadence favor action.

predictions.text: SAP’s December 2025 Security Notes (Patch Day) will include at least one HotNews note (CVSS v3.x Base Score ≥ 9.0).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via SAP Security Notes portal/blog for December 2025; at least one note labeled 'HotNews' or with CVSS v3.x Base Score ≥ 9.0 published on Patch Day.
evidence: SAP typically issues HotNews notes most months
December cycles historically include critical fixes
Third-party advisories often flag SAP High/CRIT in Dec
monitoring_signals: CVE/NVD entries mapped to SAP on Patch Day
predictions.rationale: SAP regularly ships critical notes; December is often active.

predictions.text: Netflix or Warner Bros. Discovery will publicly disclose receipt of a 'Second Request' under the HSR Act for their proposed transaction by 2026-01-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Disclosure via SEC filing (e.g., Form 8-K) or official company press/investor statement explicitly stating receipt of an HSR 'Second Request' regarding the deal.
evidence: Large media mergers typically face in-depth review
Heightened U.S. antitrust scrutiny of tech/media consolidation
Deal size and market overlap invite Second Request
monitoring_signals: SEC EDGAR 8-Ks for NFLX and WBD
predictions.rationale: Scale and antitrust climate make a Second Request likely.
